file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 23-51-10-04 - FRONT RAMP JACK - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FRONT RAMP JACK - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Front Ramp Jack. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 23-51-10-000-801-A FRONT RAMP JACK - REMOVAL ALL 23-51-10-400-801-A FRONT RAMP JACK - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 23-51-10 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-51-10-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FRONT RAMP JACK - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the Front Ramp Jack. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 24-36-01-000-801-A/400 MAIN BATTERY - REMOVAL SB145-23-0004 - WM 23-51-53 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113EL Forward fuselage Section l - LH side 113 113DL Forward fuselage Section l - LH side D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Soldering Iron To remove the solder and release the wires available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE At the main-battery-compartment door and 1 Does the task external-power-receptacle door I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the PA circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/COMM/PA). (2) Open doors 113EL and 113DL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-51-10 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Remove the main batteries (AMM TASK 24-36-01-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) (PRE-MOD SB145-23-0004) Do the Front Ramp Jack removal as follows: (a) Open the main-battery-compartment door to get access to the rear of the ramp jack panel. (b) Remove the two screws (8), nuts (5), and washers (6). (c) Remove the nut (3), washer (4), and plate (7). (d) Pull the front ramp jack (9). (e) Unsolder the electrical wires. (f) Remove the front ramp jack (9). (g) Remove the nut (1) and washer (2). (h) Pull the switch (10) and remove the two wires. (i) Remove the switch (10). (2) (POST-MOD SB145-23-0004) Do the Front Ramp Jack removal as follows: (a) Open the main-battery-compartment door to get access to the rear of the ramp jack panel. (b) Remove the two screws (7), nuts (4), and washers (5). (c) Remove the nut (9), washer (8), and plate (6). (d) Cut the electric wires near the splices (WM 23-51-53). NOTE: Make match marks on all the electrical wires or cables before you disconnect them to make the installation easier. (e) Remove the front ramp jack (3). (f) Remove the nut (1) and washer (2). (g) Pull the switch (10) and remove the two wires. (h) Remove the switch (10). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-51-10 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: PRE-MOD SB 145-23-0004 Front Ramp Jack - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 113 DET. A B 1. NUT 2. WASHER 3. NUT 4. WASHER 5. NUT (4) 6. WASHER (4) 7. PLATE 8. SCREW (2) 9. FRONT RAMP JACK DET. B 10. SWITCH 145AMM230141.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-51-10 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: POST-MOD SB 145-23-0004 Front Ramp Jack - Removal/Installation Figure 402 B A ZONES 113 DET. A 1. NUT 2. WASHER 3. FRONT RAMP JACK 4. NUT (4) 5. WASHER (4) 6. PLATE 7. SCREW (2) 8. WASHER DET. B 9. NUT 10. SWITCH 145AMM230190.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 23-51-10 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-51-10-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. FRONT RAMP JACK - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the Front Ramp Jack. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 23-51-00-700-802-A/500 AUDIO SYSTEM - OPERATIONAL TEST AMM TASK 24-36-01-400-801-A/400 MAIN BATTERY - INSTALLATION SB145-23-0004 - WM 20-21-00/2 - WM 23-51-53 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113EL Forward fuselage Section l - LH side 113 113DL Forward fuselage Section l - LH side D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Soldering Iron To solder the wires available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE At the main-battery-compartment door and 1 Does the task external-power-receptacle door I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) (PRE-MOD SB145-23-0004) Do the Front Ramp Jack installation as follows: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 23-51-10 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Open the main-battery-compartment door to get access to the rear of the ramp jack panel. (b) Install the switch (10). (c) Install the two wires and push the switch (10). (d) Install the washer (2) and nut (1). (e) Install the front ramp jack (9). (f) Solder the four electrical wires. (g) Push the front ramp jack (9). (h) Install the plate (7), washer (4), and nut (3). (i) Install the two screws (8), washers (6), and nuts (5). (2) (POST-MOD SB145-23-0004) Do the Front Ramp Jack installation as follows: (a) Open the main-battery-compartment door to get access to the rear of the ramp jack panel. (b) Install the switch (10). (c) Install the two wires and push the switch (10). (d) Install the washer (2) and nut (1). (e) Install the front ramp jack (9). CAUTION: REFER TO THE MATCH MARKS MADE DURING THE REMOVAL WHEN YOU CONNECT THE ELECTRICAL WIRES OR CABLES. INCORRECT CONNECTION OF WIRES OR CABLES WILL CAUSE DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT. (f) Connect the electric wires with splices (WM 20-21-00/2) (WM 23-51-53). (g) Push the front ramp jack (9). (h) Install the plate (7), washer (4), and nut (3). (i) Install the two screws (8), washers (6), and nuts (5). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the main batteries (AMM TASK 24-36-01-400-801-A/400). (2) Close doors 113DL and 113EL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) On the circuit breaker panel, close the PA circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT- CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/COMM/PA). (4) Do the Audio-System Operational Test ( AMM TASK 23-51-00-700-802-A/500 - Interphone tests only). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 23-51-10 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
